title: RRB Clerk Prelims: Reasoning (7th Dec Shift 1) #RA005

questions.text:
Directions (1-5): Study the following series carefully and answer the question given below:

P & K * V Z L # W A % S R ! M @ X F Y ? Q + C ^ U T Z $

Q1. Which symbol is fifth to the right of the third letter from the left end in the series?
questions.solution: The third letter from the left end is V. The symbols to the right of V are #, %, !, @, ?. The fifth symbol is '?'.

questions.text: Q2. If all symbols and vowels are removed from the series, which element is sixth from the right end in the remaining series?
questions.solution: Removing symbols and vowels: P K V Z L W S R M X F Y Q C T Z. Counting from right: Z(1), T(2), C(3), Q(4), Y(5), F(6). The element is F.

questions.text: Q3. Which element is fourth to the right of the seventh symbol from the right end?
questions.solution: Symbols from right: $, ^, +, ?, @, !, %. The 7th symbol is %. The 4th element to the right of % is M (S, R, !, M).

questions.text: Q4. How many letters in the series are immediately preceded and immediately followed by a symbol?
questions.solution: Pattern: Symbol-Letter-Symbol. Pairs: &K*, !M@, ?Q+, +C^. Total 4.

questions.text: Q5. How many vowels in the series are immediately followed by a letter?
questions.solution: Vowels in series: A, U. 'A' is followed by '%'. 'U' is followed by 'T'. Only U is followed by a letter. Total 1.

questions.text:
Directions (6-8): Study the following information carefully and answer the questions given below:
A certain number of persons sit in a row and face north. H sits third to the right of K. Five persons sit between H and D. E sits immediately left of K. Only two persons sit between D and J. A sits second to the right of J. A and D are not immediate neighbours. Number of persons sit between E and D is same as the number of persons sit to the right of D. E sits second from one the ends of the row.

Q6. Who among the following persons sits 11th to the left of A?
questions.solution: Based on the arrangement, H sits 11th to the left of A.

questions.text: Q7. What is the position of J in the row?
questions.solution: J sits seventh from the right end.

questions.text: Q8. How many persons sit in the row?
questions.solution: Total persons in the row is 21.

questions.text:
Directions (9-12): In this question, relationship between different elements is shown in the statements. The statements are followed by two conclusions.

Q9. Statements: K <= F < R = G > U < V = W
Conclusions:
I. R > W
II. K < G
options: If only conclusion I is true
If only conclusion II is true
If either conclusion I or II is true
If both conclusions I and II are true
If neither conclusion I nor II is true
questions.solution: I. R > W (False). II. K < G (True, as K <= F < R = G).

questions.text:
Q10. Statements: M > B <= C <= A = E <= O >= F > G = P
Conclusions:
I. P < O
II. O >= B
options: If only conclusion I is true
If only conclusion II is true
If either conclusion I or II is true
If both conclusions I and II are true
If neither conclusion I nor II is true
questions.solution: I. P < O (True). II. O >= B (True). Both follow.

questions.text:
Q11. Statements: L = M <= N <= O = P > Q <= R
Conclusions:
I. P > L
II. N < R
options: If only conclusion I is true
If only conclusion II is true
If either conclusion I or II is true
If both conclusions I and II are true
If neither conclusion I nor II is true
questions.solution: I. P >= L (False). II. N relation with R is unknown (False). Neither follows.

questions.text:
Q12. Statements: X >= Y > Z = A > B < C > D = E
Conclusions:
I. X > B
II. Z <= E
options: If only conclusion I is true
If only conclusion II is true
If either conclusion I or II is true
If both conclusions I and II are true
If neither conclusion I nor II is true
questions.solution: I. X > B (True). II. Z > B < C > D = E (False). Only I follows.

questions.text:
Directions (13-15): C is the sister-in-law of D. A is the son of H. B is the mother-in-law of G. G is the mother of E. E is the sister of A. There is no single parent in the family.

Q13. How is A related to D?
questions.solution: A is the grandson of D (based on family tree structure: C(-)-B(-)=D(+), H(+)=G(-), E(-)-A(+)).

questions.text: Q14. How many female members are there in the family?
questions.solution: Females: C, B, G, E. Total 4.

questions.text: Q15. How is H related to D?
questions.solution: H is the son of D.

questions.text: Q16. In the number '5693728', if all the digits are arranged in descending order from left end, then how many digits remain unchanged at its position in the new number formed after rearrangement?
questions.solution: Original: 5 6 9 3 7 2 8. Descending: 9 8 7 6 5 3 2. No digit matches its position.

questions.text:
Directions (17-21): Seven boxes A, B, C, D, E, F and G are placed one above the other. Three boxes are placed between box B and box D. Box A is placed immediately below box B. Number of boxes placed below box A is same as the number of boxes placed above box G. One box is placed between box G and box C which is placed above box G. Box E is not placed at the bottommost position.

Q17. Which box is placed at third position from top?
questions.solution: Arrangement (Top to Bottom): B, A, E, C, D, G, F. 3rd from top is E.

questions.text: Q18. How many boxes are placed above box C?
questions.solution: Above C are B, A, E. Total 3.

questions.text: Q19. If all the boxes are arranged in alphabetical order from bottom to top, then how many boxes will remain same at their position?
questions.solution: One box remains in the same position.

questions.text: Q20. What is the position of box G from bottom?
questions.solution: G is placed 2nd from the bottom.

questions.text: Q21. Which of the following box is placed two boxes below box A?
questions.solution: Two boxes below A is C.

questions.text:
Directions (22-25): 492 625 381 967 154

Q22. If the first and third digit of each number is interchanged within the number, then which of the following will be the second highest number?
questions.solution: New numbers: 294, 526, 183, 769, 451. Second highest is 526 (from 625).

questions.text: Q23. If the digits are arranged in ascending order within the number, then what will be the sum of first and the second highest numbers?
questions.solution: Arranged: 249, 256, 138, 679, 145. Highest 679, 2nd Highest 256. Sum = 935. (Note: The options provided in PDF seem mismatched with question type, but correct index from solution is 'Three').

questions.text: Q24. What will be the sum of the second digits of 'highest and the second smallest' number?
questions.solution: Highest 967 (2nd digit 6). 2nd Smallest 381 (2nd digit 8). Sum = 14.

questions.text: Q25. If 2 is added to each number then how many numbers will be completely divisible by 3?
questions.solution: 494 (No), 627 (Yes), 383 (No), 969 (Yes), 156 (Yes). Three numbers.

questions.text:
Directions (26-30): A, B, C, D, E, F and G were born on same date of different months... A was born in the month having even number of days. Three persons were born between A and C. G is two months older to C. E was born immediately after G. Two persons were born between E and B. D is younger to B.

Q26. Who among the following was born in July?
questions.solution: B was born in July.

questions.text: Q27. Four of the following five are similar in a certain manner and form a group. Who among the following is not related to the group?
questions.solution: A is the odd one out.

questions.text: Q28. D was born in which of the following month?
questions.solution: D was born in August.

questions.text: Q29. How many persons were born between G and F?
questions.solution: Two persons were born between G and F.

questions.text: Q30. If all the persons are arranged in alphabetical order from March to September, then how many persons will remain same at their position?
questions.solution: One person remains in the same position.

questions.text:
Directions (31-33): Statements: Only a few cup is can. All cup is kettle. No can is jar.
Conclusions:
I. Some kettle is not jar
II. No Cup is jar
options: If either conclusion I or II follows
If neither conclusion I nor II follows
If both conclusions I and II follow
questions.solution: I. Some Kettle is Cup, Cup intersects Can, Can is No Jar. So parts of Kettle (Cup-Can intersection) are not Jar. True. II. False.

questions.text:
Q32. Statements: Some colours are pens. All pens are pencils. Only a few pencils are glitters.
Conclusions:
I. All pencils being glitters is a possibility
II. Some colours are pencils
options: If either conclusion I or II follows
If neither conclusion I nor II follows
If both conclusions I and II follow
questions.solution: I. False (Only a few constraint). II. True (Colours -> Pens -> Pencils).

questions.text:
Q33. Statements: All lines are square. Only a few square are circles.
Conclusions:
I. Some square are not circles
II. Some lines being circles is a possibility
options: If either conclusion I or II follows
If neither conclusion I nor II follows
If both conclusions I and II follow
questions.solution: I. True (Due to Only a few). II. True (Possibility exists).

questions.text:
Q34. Statements: All fruits are vegetable. Only a few vegetable are carrot. Some carrot are not tomato.
Conclusions:
I. All fruits being tomato is a possibility
II. No vegetable is carrot
options: If either conclusion I or II follows
If neither conclusion I nor II follows
If both conclusions I and II follow
questions.solution: The question asks which conclusion logically *doesn't* follow. I. Possible. II. False (Some Veg are Carrot). So II doesn't follow.

questions.text: Q35. In the word 'SOLVENT', how many pairs of the letters have the same number of letters between them (both forward and backward direction) as in the English alphabet?
questions.solution: Three pairs.

questions.text:
Directions (36-40): Seven persons A, B, C, D, E, F and G sit around a circular table facing inside... 
Q36. What is the position of F with respect to B?
questions.solution: F sits immediate right of B.

questions.text: Q37. Who among the following sits second to the right of G?
questions.solution: E sits second to the right of G.

questions.text: Q38. How many persons sit between D and E when counted from the right of D?
questions.solution: Three persons sit between D and E.

questions.text: Q39. If B is related to E, in the similar way C is related to G, then who among the following is related to F?
questions.solution: D is related to F.

questions.text: Q40. If all the are made to sit in alphabetical order starting from A in clockwise direction, then how many persons will remain same at their position (excluding A)?
questions.solution: Two persons remain in the same position.
